title: The 3 A's of awesome - Neil Pasricha

options.label: B
options.text: To focus on the positive aspects of life

options.label: C
options.text: To write about his childhood experiences

options.label: D
options.text: To discuss current events and news

options.label: B
options.text: Being aware of one's own strengths and weaknesses

options.label: C
options.text: Being aware of the opinions of others

options.label: D

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: The Eisenhower matrix: understanding task management

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Responding to an urgent phone call from a colleague

options.label: D
options.text: Surfing the internet without a reason

options.label: B
options.text: To help you delegate tasks more effectively

options.label: C
options.text: To help you eliminate distractions and procrastination

options.label: D
options.text: To help you schedule tasks more efficiently

multiple-choice.question: According to Dwight Eisenhower, what is the relationship between importance and urgency?

options.label: A
options.text: What's important is always urgent, and what's urgent is always important

options.label: B
options.text: What's important is seldom urgent, and what's urgent is seldom important

options.label: C
options.text: What's important is always more urgent than what's not important

options.label: D
